abstract: Boston Globe reports former Boston crime boss James (Whitey) Bulger, responding to three high school girls who wrote to him for history project, advises them in letter to go to law school; he is serving two life sentences in federal prison in Florida.
lead_paragraph: When three high school girls wrote to James (Whitey) Bulger for a history project, his response included: “If you want to make crime pay go to law school.”

headline.main: Jailed Crime Boss’s Tip to Students: Go to Law School
headline.print_headline: Jailed Crime Boss’s Tip to Students: Go to Law School

snippet: When three high school girls wrote to James (Whitey) Bulger for a history project, his response included: “If you want to make crime pay go to law school.”
